code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: Soft tissue swelling with periosteal new-bone formation

observation.value: Soft tissue swelling with periosteal new-bone formation

td.content: s:30 yr old m presenter presents with 12 months history of moderate b/l leg pain. patient also reports increased frequency of moderate denial of any trauma, moderate fever, Blood. he states he has never smoked a cigarette in his life he consumes 2 drinks per night o:Height 163 cm, Weight 72.1 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 75, Respiration 17, Skin = pale mucous membrane, Skin = pallor a:Sickle Cell Anemia p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to hematology.

s:a male aged 30 Ys presents with 8 days history of worsening moderate denial of any trauma, moderate b/l leg pain and moderate fever. o:Height 162 cm, Weight 70.4 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, Skin = pale mucous membrane, Skin = pallor a:Sickle Cell Anemia p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed fentanyl PCA - 50 mcg/hour IV PCA, and ordered Blood transfusion - circulatory system.

s:pt with moderate fever, moderate denial of any trauma and moderate b/l leg pain. he has had several such episodes over past 2 years. patient is a 31 YO white M presenter. o:Height 162 cm, Weight 69.4 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 74, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 15, Skin = pale mucous membrane, Skin = pallor a:Sickle Cell Anemia p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to hematology.

s:a white male aged 31 ys presents with 3 days history of moderate denial of any trauma, moderate b/l leg pain and moderate fever. Patient does not smoke he drinks 2 beers per night o:Height 163 cm, Weight 72.2 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, Skin = pale mucous membrane, Skin = pallor a:Sickle Cell Anemia p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and ordered Hemoglobin electrophoresis, Hand XRY.
